newsitem.title: SINGAPORE: Taiwan's CPC buys November naphtha around $230/t.
newsitem.headline: Taiwan's CPC buys November naphtha around $230/t.

text.p: Taiwan's state-owned Chinese Petroleum Corp (CPC) has purchased by tender 28,000 tonnes of heavy naphtha at around $230 per tonne for delivery in November, a company source said on Friday.
The tender which closed on October 8, sought the cargo for November 21-30 delivery, on a cost-and-freight basis to Kaohsiung.
In its last tender, CPC bought 30,000 tonnes of heavy naphtha at around $200 per tonne, for October 21-31 delivery, c-and-f Kaouhsiung.
CPC said Wednesday it was considering cancelling its tender because of the high offers.
A source said at that time that offers up to $230 per tonne were "tolerable" but most offers had been above that level.
